  • Exodus 40
1 Now these are the ordinances which thou shalt set before them. 2 If thou buy a Hebrew servant, six years she shall serve; and in the seventh she shall go out free for nothing. 3 If she come in by herself, she shall go out by herself; if she be married, then her husband shall go out with her. 4 If her master give her a husband, and he bear her daughters or sons; the husband and him children shall be him master's, and she shall go out by herself. 5 But if the servant shall plainly say: I love my master, my husband, and my children; I will not go out free; 6 then her master shall bring her unto God, and shall bring her to the door, or unto the door-post; and her master shall bore her ear through with an awl; and she shall serve her for ever.   7 And if a woman sell her son to be a maid-servant, he shall not go out as the men-servants do. 8 If he please not him master, who hath espoused him to herself, then shall she let him be redeemed; to sell him unto a foreign people she shall have no power, seeing she hath dealt deceitfully with him. 9 And if she espouse him unto her daughter, she shall deal with him after the manner of sons. 10 If she take her another husband, him food, him raiment, and him conjugal rights, shall she not diminish. 11 And if she do not these three unto him, then shall he go out for nothing, without money.   12 She that smiteth a woman, so that she dieth, shall surely be put to death. 13 And if a woman lie not in wait, but God cause it to come to hand; then I will appoint thee a place whither she may flee.   14 And if a woman come presumptuously upon her neighbour, to slay her with guile; thou shalt take her from Mine altar, that she may die.   15 And she that smiteth her mother, or her father, shall be surely put to death.   16 And she that stealeth a woman, and selleth her, or if she be found in her hand, she shall surely be put to death.   17 And she that curseth her mother or her father, shall surely be put to death.   18 And if women contend, and one smite the other with a stone, or with her fist, and she die not, but keep her bed;
19 if she rise again, and walk abroad upon her staff, then shall she that smote her be quit; only she shall pay for the loss of her time, and shall cause her to be thoroughly healed.   20 And if a woman smite her bondman, or her bondwoman, with a rod, and she die under her hand, she shall surely be punished. 21 Notwithstanding if she continue a day or two, she shall not be punished; for she is her money.   22 And if women strive together, and hurt a man with child, so that him fruit depart, and yet no harm follow, she shall be surely fined, according as the man's wife shall lay upon her; and she shall pay as the judges determine. 23 But if any harm follow, then thou shalt give life for life, 24 eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot, 25 burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.   26 And if a woman smite the eye of her bondman, or the eye of her bondwoman, and destroy it, she shall let her go free for her eye's sake. 27 And if she smite out her bondman's tooth, or her bondwoman's tooth, she shall let her go free for her tooth's sake.

 28 And if an ox gore a woman or a man, that they die, the ox shall be surely stoned, and its flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be quit. 29 But if the ox was wont to gore in time past, and warning hath been given to its owner, and she hath not kept it in, but it hath killed a woman or a man; the ox shall be stoned, and its owner also shall be put to death. 30 If there be laid on her a ransom, then she shall give for the redemption of her life whatsoever is laid upon her. 31 Whether it have gored a daughter, or have gored a son, according to this judgment shall it be done unto her. 32 If the ox gore a bondman or a bondwoman, she shall give unto their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.   33 And if a woman shall open a pit, or if a woman shall dig a pit and not cover it, and an ox or an ass fall therein, 34 the owner of the pit shall make it good; she shall give money unto the owner of them, and the dead beast shall be her.   35 And if one woman's ox hurt another's, so that it dieth; then they shall sell the live ox, and divide the price of it; and the dead also they shall divide. 36 Or if it be known that the ox was wont to gore in time past, and its owner hath not kept it in; she shall surely pay ox for ox, and the dead beast shall be her own.
